attributes.action: change the anti smoking labels on cigarette packets to pictures
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: the more a person knows about the damage smoking causes to themselves, the more likely they will be to quit. by changing the warnings on cigarette packets from writing to pictures (eg. damaged lungs caused by smoking), the british government will be able to create a greater disincentive to smoke  which will therefore save countless lives each year and thus reduce the amount of public money spent treating smoking related diseases. we petition the government to take legislative action to ensure that the warnings on cigarette packets are changed from writing to pictures eg, damaged lungs

rejection.details: This has already been done. The new pictures were introduced this autumn, and should be appearing in shops as older stock is sold off. Please see http://www.dh.gov.uk/en/Publichealth/Healthimprovement/Tobacco/Tobaccogeneralinformation/DH_4083845
reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
